definition: noble and lowly/high versus low social hierarchy of ruler to people, father to son, husband to wife in Confucianism
social stratum below the level of ordinary people/untouchable/dalit (India caste)
not shaken by poverty/to preserve one's ambitions although destitute
morally loose, lewd and low, lascivious and mean/wanton

sentences.english: Ornery or not, You've been M. I. A for over a month.
sentences.chinese: 贱不贱我不管，你失踪了有一个多月了。

sentences.english: Ornery or not, You've been M. I. A for over a month.
sentences.chinese: 贱不贱我不管，你失踪了有一个多月了。

sentences.english: The price of a setter within is the most expensive.
sentences.chinese: 边滚筒式照排机的代价是最不贱的。

sentences.english: Be it dear or cheap, we shall take it.
sentences.chinese: 不管它是贵或贱，我们都要买。

sentences.english: I am humbly old and afraid of nothing now.
sentences.chinese: 我这老命是又贱又硬，我还有什么事好害怕呢。

sentences.english: We cannot transubstantiate base metals into gold.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能把贱金属变成金子。

sentences.english: The peacock has fair feathers, but foul feet.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀虽有华羽，但有贱脚。

sentences.english: Waste computer mainboards contain abundant precious metals and other valuable metals.
sentences.chinese: 报废电脑主板中含有大量的贵金属和贱金属元素。

sentences.english: Then her mother's cheap, let your sister make you regret it.
sentences.chinese: 再她妈的贱，姐让你就让你后悔。

sentences.english: The cheap metal Zn electrode paste was studied in this experiments.
sentences.chinese: 对贱金属锌浆料进行了实验研究。

sentences.english: I am the stationmaster that loves high-definition community only, want to exchange friendship link with expensive website.
sentences.chinese: 人是唯恨下清社区的坐少，思与贱网坐接换友情链接。

sentences.english: It is impossible to transmute base metals into gold.
sentences.chinese: 把贱金属变成黄金是不可能的。

sentences.english: Base metals in particular have borne the brunt of investors de-risking portfolios.
sentences.chinese: 在投资者消除资产风险时，贱金属首当其冲。

sentences.english: This year’s losers are likely to be socalled base metals.
sentences.chinese: 今年最大的输家莫过于“贱金属”了。
你说是看《贱女孩》还是《恋恋笔记本》呢？

definition: to have no sense of shame/shameless
morally loose, lewd and low, lascivious and mean/wanton
ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
stupid/sluggish/clumsy/to wiggle (of worms)/to move in a disorderly fashion
to stop one's pen/to break off writing/final remarks (at the end of a book or article)
